result.execSummary:
The defendant Wade Nathan Rudoll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 16CF27 and 16CF404 called at 10:08am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Wade Nathan Rudoll in court with attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.  Defendant Wade Nathan Rudoll in custody.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF27 - AMENDED INFORMATION filed by the State. 
Basis for the amendment reviewed by Counsel and approved by the Court. 
Service admitted, reading waived. 

As to both cases - 
Plea questionnaire and rights form submitted.  Constitutional rights given.  Maximum penalties and elements recited.
16CF27 - Count # 1 and Count #2 of the AMENDED INFORMATION and 16CF404 - Count #2 - NO CONTEST plea entered by the Def.   Factual basis stipulated.  Victim compliance verified.  Court accepts the plea and Finds the Def. guilty and Orders that Judgment of Conviction be entered.
State moves to read-in and dismiss Count #1 in case 16CF404.
Recommendations presented by ADA Hall. 
Victim impact statement and restitution information submitted by the State. 
Recommendations presented by Atty. Humes. 

The Court discloses that it is known that the defendant was recorded threatening to burn down the home of Judge Koschnick; reviews circumstances.  Neither counsel indicate knowledge/receipt of the Memorandum from the Court on the matter. 
The Court will recall the case at 11:30am to allow Counsel time to review the material sent by the Court. 
Recess 10:32am

Cases recalled at 11:48am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Wade Nathan Rudoll in court with attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.  Defendant Wade Nathan Rudoll in custody.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both counsel indicate that they have had enough time to review the materials provided. 
State takes no position on the Court proceeding with this matter. 
Response presented by Atty. Humes.  Defense requests to proceed at this time. 
Additional arguments presented by Atty. Humes. 

The Court orders:
16CF27:
- Count #1 - 90 days jail per count to be served in the WSP consecutive to the sentence ordered in 16CF404 and consecutive to the sentence being served in 15CF49. The defendant has no credit for time served. 
- Count #2 - 90 days jail per count to be served in the WSP concurrent to the sentnce in Count #1 but consecutive to the sentence ordered in 16CF404 and consecutive to the sentence being served in 15CF49. The defendant has no credit for time served. 
- DNA sample compliance. 
- Costs and DNA surcharge - to be entered as civil judgments. 

16CF404:
- 6 months jail per count to be served in the WSP consecutive to the sentence ordered in 16CF27 and consecutive to the sentence being served in 15CF49. The defendant has no credit for time served. 
- DNA sample compliance. 
- Costs and DNA surcharge  - to be entered as civil judgments. 

If the sentences are served in the WSP, the Court finds that the defendant is no eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Recess 12:02pm
AMENDED
cc: DA cert. copy by COC on 3/20/17. sf

[MK] cases #16CF27 and #16CF404 called at 2:07pm. 
Defendant Wade Nathan Rudoll appears via videoconferencing from Stanley Correctional Institution, in custody.  His counsel, Attorney Samantha Humes is in court.  DA Susan Happ appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Humes indicates that the parties are finalizing a plea agreement in these cases; she requests the scheduling of a plea and sentencing hearing. 
Attorney Humes provides Mr. Rudoll's DOC number as being: #606585;  and she provides the Stanley Correctional Institution address of 100 Corrections Drive, Stanley WI 54768-6500.

NOH sent to the jail//no longer there
Initial appearance on April 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Clerk's note:  This case was placed on the "Intake" list generated by the JCSO for Initial Appearance today, however the hearing was removed from the calendar because the case is awaiting judicial assignment.  
During the 1:15 Intake videoconference-appearances in Branch II, Defendant Wade Rudoll appeared briefly along with Attorney E. Svehlek.  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint was present in the courtroom. 
The Court did not call the case, so no record was made.  The clerk explained that the case will be rescheduled once the newly assigned Judge is known.  
Attorney Svehlek asked that it be noted that Mr. Rudoll is being released from incarceration on March 30th, and that thereafter he will reside at the Cambridge address in the file.
The Court concludes the substitution request is timely and in proper form, per Wis State 971.20 cc:All
